p: Fig 3 also shows an increase in chikungunya number of cases registered in Rio de Janeiro in 2016 and then a notable reduction in 2017, followed by an increase in CHIKV transmission in 2018 accounting for 39,208 reported cases until epidemiological week 44. Rio de Janeiroâ€™s epidemic curve also shows that the state alone accounted for 66.8% and 69.7% of the cumulative cases registered in the south-eastern region in 2016 and 2018, respectively. While a reduction in the number of cases was observed in the north-eastern region in 2018, the south-eastern region kept experiencing increased CHIKV transmission ( Fig 3). In general, CHIKV cases peaked in the early months of the represented years, consistent with previous virus dynamics predictions ( Fig 3) [ 15, 44].
